name: CVE-2013-6646
description: Use-after-free vulnerability in the Web Workers implementation in Google Chrome before 32.0.1700.76 on Windows and before 32.0.1700.77 on Mac OS X and Linux allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact via vectors related to the shutting down of a worker process.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:google:chrome:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:apple:mac_os_x:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:linux:linux_kernel:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*')) OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:opensuse:opensuse:12.3:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:opensuse:opensuse:13.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:8.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:debian:debian_linux:7.0:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') OR ((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:google:chrome:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
